benchmark_details.name: edgar -corpus
benchmark_details.overview: edgar -corpus is the largest financial NLP corpus available, comprising annual reports from all publicly traded companies in the US, spanning a period of more than 25 years, provided in an easy-to-use JSON format.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive financial NLP corpus that facilitates research in financial text analysis.

data.source: Annual reports (10-K filings) from all publicly traded companies in the US collected via web crawling.
data.annotation: Manual extraction of sections from annual reports.

methodology.calculation: Standard metrics such as Accuracy, F1 Score, and MSE were used to evaluate the performance in financial NLP tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Better performance indicates better embeddings for financial NLP tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: edgar -w2v outperforms generic glove embeddings and other financial embeddings.
